meaningMnemonic: You have the kanji for <kanji>three</kanji> and <kanji>person</kanji>. Common sense will tell you what this word is. It's <vocabulary>three people</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo (kanji compound) word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since 人 has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Apparently, there are <vocabulary>three people</vocabulary> working as <reading>San</reading>ta-san at <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (さんにん)! It's a big company, so obviously they need three Santas.
